instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_POWER_GOOD: What is ALL_SYS_POWER_GOOD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS_POWER_GOOD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Hi 

Quarter fan spin when battery connected.
With no battery connected no boot / fan spin.

PPBUS G3H 8.2v
PP3V42 G3H 3.4
PP5V S5 5v
PP3V3 3.3v

I replaced capacitors <CAPACITOR>C1992</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1902</CAPACITOR> as they looked damanged

Thanks in advance.

James

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
"PPBUS G3H 8.2v"
Is this without battery connected?
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
"PPBUS G3H 8.57 with no battery, 8.38 with battery
3 <SIGNAL>V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.29v with and without battery

is battery bus <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Voltages

SCL  - 2.9 - 3.4 (fluctuates)
SDA - ditto 

with battery and PSU connected.

SCL 0.477
SDA - 0.457

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
I'm not sure if you checked diode mode with power applied on the board.
If yes, do NOT do it again ever!

However, 8.57V is good voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, so no reason to check there anymore.
Keep battery out, until get the board starting with charger alone.

"With no battery connected no boot / fan spin."
Do you mean the board stays on, fan spins continously, but doesn't boot?
If yes, check <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

Any history fault available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Hello

No power supply connected with Diode Mode.

"With no battery connected no boot / fan spin."
- With no battery connected, the laptop does not do quarter fan spin, or boot in any way.

Computer was "fine" before customer brought it in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
So to clarify
With no battery connected, computer will try to boot, drawing about .185a then restart approx every 3 seconds.
the fan does not move.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Use original 45/60W Magsafe 2 charger for tests.
See if board stays on in SMC bypass mode.

If board restarts every 3s, is power cycling.
Check if appears voltage pulse on all big coils; especially PCH/CPU.
Also check for pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Hello
In SMC bypass mode the board does the 3 second thing.

(Just checking, hold down power, plug in magsafe, hold power button for 10 seconds, release) Fan immediately spins but ony for a second. 

I'm not 100% sure what you mena by "  all big coils; especially PCH/CPU. " but this is what I've checked

L7310 - 3.2v
L7320 -3.9v
<CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR> - 3.6v

 <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - no pulse
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_POWER_GOOD</SIGNAL> - this was strange it might have just been my multimter, Most of the time it would pulseat 5.3v but We watched it for a while ( about 10 pulses) and it would range between 27v - 4v

James

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
I'm not sure how did you get so high pulses, especially on PCH and CPU coils.

Use SMC mode to check for voltage, if then have 1s fan spining.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check, without disconnecting power, once entered SMC bypass.
If <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and mentioned coils pulse, then check at pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Hello

Thank you for your help so far but I am not understanding.

What do you mean by SMC mode? Do You want me to check the coils again in that mode?
How do I Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> ?

Kind regards

James

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
You've said to get consistent 1s power in SMC bypass.
Once in that mode, do not disconnect charger; machine will remain in that mode when you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and get another 1s power.
This will help you to measure something.
But, if you note to get the same 1s power in normal mode, do it then.
SMC bypass helps you note when power appears, because of fan spins high.

"How do I Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?"
You have more than 1 year on the forum, I didn't expect such question...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
Sorry, I don't do that many board repairs. Maybe 20 a year.

I have tried SMC in bypass mode with no change. i.e. I still get the power pulse and no fan spin.

I will give up on this board for now. Thank you for the help.
